thread.title: CBS: Dead money teams among league's worst & Saints have most

title: CBS: Dead money teams among league's worst & Saints have most
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest CBS: Dead money teams among league's worst & Saints have most NEW ORLEANS – The Saints have the most 'dead money' in the NFL and they, along with the other teams that lead the league in 'dead money' have a Post to Facebook CBS: Dead money teams among league's worst & Saints have most NEW ORLEANS – The Saints have the most 'dead money' in the NFL and they, along with the other teams that lead the league in 'dead money' have a  //on.wwltv.com/1LumBgP   CBS: Dead money teams among league's worst & Saints have most From CBS sports.com 3:48 p.m. CDT October 14, 2015 NEW ORLEANS, LA - AUGUST 15: Jimmy Graham #80 of the New Orleans Saints celebrates a touchdown during a preseason game against the Tennessee Titans at the Mercedes-Benz Superdome on August 15, 2014 in New Orleans, Louisiana. (Photo by Stacy Revere/Getty Images) (Photo: Stacy Revere, Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
NEW ORLEANS – The Saints have the most 'dead money' in the NFL and they, along with the other teams that lead the league in 'dead money' have a combined 9-25. The information is from a story on cbssports.com. 
Dead money is the amount of money being paid to players no longer on the roster that counts against the team's salary cap. 
The Saints have $31.07 million in 'dead money' out of the team's salary cap of $145 million and change. That's 21 percent of the cap being paid to players no longer on the team. 
The bulk of it is to players let go – Jimmy Graham ($9 million), Ben Grubbs ($6 million), Curtis Lofton ($5 million) and Junior Galette ($4.2 million). 
The most ominous note for Saints fans in the article is the fact that Galette's dead money for next year will be $12.1 million. Read or Share this story: http://on.wwltv.com/1LumBgP TOP VIDEOS
